description: Nice alternative to VSCode. Extension installation works seemlessly.

moved from atom as development stopped. Quite some time needed to find good theme but found one (Skill avid pure black) and customized also the panel. Menu can be hidden. 
Minimap, file browser, syntaxt completion, all good. So far 4*, need to dig deeper to debugger and so on.
This doesn't work. Just hangs. Archlinux 02-Jun-2020

VSCodium is undoubtedly the most useful code editor I have ever used. Performance and functionality coexist in this program, and they do it well. This is no doubt made even faster by removing the proprietary Microsoft integration.

Thank you, developers.

I'm running debian testing with the latest linux-surface kernel. 

This app opens and then stalls before crashing in a couple seconds. 

The version from vscodium's site works for me.
Ubuntu 20.04 - doesn't work
Due to the sandboxing of flatpaks the editor does not easily work with host tools (compilers, SDKs etc.). This is a critical flaw for a code editor or IDE.
summary: Does not integrate well with host tooling

description: A great text editor is still the most important feature every modern computing environment needs, this is solid choice!
perfect, never an issue
The loading issue was fixed and it's back to running smoothly and doing everything it's counterpart can.
Modular design so that it's lightweight but is able to be powerful when needed

So been using this the past few days, and wow it's a great tool. I'm glad this build exists because I really don't want to touch VS Code proper. Lighted I'm just doing minor edits and haven't really tested this thing to it's full potential yet.

I usually use VIM but need VSCode for a project. This build is perfect to escape MS telemetry. 

It works perfectly on F32, including the sandboxing.

It doesn't hang, flathub is just installing prerequisites like freedesktop. Prerequisites are around 400MB while VSCodium is less than a100MB. Gnome doesn't show progress while installing prerequisites.
Flatpak are great, but download size : 1.7Gb

The app is pretty much the VSCode experience, and works pretty well here on the latest Arch! However, I noticed that, since it's sandboxed, it won't have my environment variables set, so e.g. Haskell's cabal is never detected as installed. Make sure you can setup your VSCodium as fit!
No complaints so far, working great.
summary: VSCode but with the MS bloat

description: Great work, appreciate it!
Finally Microsoft doesn't track my usage data anymore, thanks!

As of 2021, it's kept up to date better than
competing forks.
This helps to avoid tracers

Microsoft gimped this product by disallowing the developers from using addons, for example C++ projects can't use intelisense due to the license. its an okay text editor but I can't use it for basic development

I tried to debug but it's not working.
Have to install MS VS Code!

It's useless because COBOL extensions don't appear.
Only through VS Code!

Why is there still a context menu? Just hide it under a button or something. Also the window decoration doesn't properly follow Firefox nor GTK nor Thunderbirds style. Also the colour of which could be pulled from the colour of the theme background or footer colour to fit with the theme of the app or in setting change it to follow system theme.

VSCodiums Grundfunktionen sind OK in der Sandbox. Nachteile: Für vollständige Sprachenunterstützung müssen Flatpak-SDKs installiert werden, die nicht gut dokumentiert sind. Geringe Kontrolle über die Sprachen-Version. Uralte Libc, weshalb Programme, die außerhalb der Sandbox kompiliert wurden, crashen können. Das integrierte Terminal startet eine Shell ohne Profil. Sehr schade, dass hinter VSCode eine wenig vertrauenswürdige Organisation steckt.
PERMITE HACER LAS MISMAS OPERACIONES Y ADQUIRIR EXTENSIONES. POCO A POCO SE CONVIERTE EN UNA ALTERNATIVA MUY INTERESANTE.
summary: RECOMENDADA SI NO QUIERES USAR PRODUCTOS DE MICROSOFT!!

description: J'adore cette appli je recommande
